page.title: 05LENHAM SQUARE
page.content: St. Mary's Church is 919 years old and has 8 bells in the tower.The oldest bell was made in 1592.The National Westminster bank is 15th century.Before it was a bank it was a priory,a pub,a cafe and a butchers.The bank has been in Lenham approximately 20 years. The Red Lion is a Whitbread pub and sells snacks and every type of beer.The Dog and Bear is a Shepherd Neame pub.It has two pool tables and it is a hotel as well.The Library is used by 64 per cent of the villagers & has a film room. The Village Hall has a stage and is used for a wide variety of events. There is a kitchen at the back. Truffles is a restaurant & hotel with a bar which is very popular.Chequer's cafe and amusement centre is in the middle of the Square.
